head.supplied: Melbourne Botan. Garden 16/11/69 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to solicit, that you will be pleased to sanction the transfer of the sum of £23.10.0 from the vote for Travelling Expenses to that for Tran...

div.p: V69/24865, unit 750, VPRS 44/P inward registered and unregistered correspondence, VA 538 Department of Crown Lands and Survey, Public Record Office, Victoria.
MS written by C. Wilhelmi and signed by M. Melbourne Botan. Garden 16/11/69

I have the honor to solicit, that you will be pleased to sanction the transfer of the sum of £23.10.0 from the vote for Travelling Expenses to that for Transit & Incidental Expenses, the balance available from the latter vote having proved insufficient to meet the outlays under that item likely to be incurred till the end of the year.

The whole vote for Publishing of Works having been left untouched this year, I have the honor to request of you, to render out of this the sum of £94 available for wages, the wages fund being considerably overdrawn, partly in consequence of the extra work caused by the drought in the earlier part of the year, and partly through the great extra calls on the labor of the whole establishment during the many months, while the excavations at the lake and the formation of the flood-dam were proceeded with.

The remaining £56 of the vote for Publishing of Works I would be glad to expend on Stores, as the ordinary Store Vote in this exceptional year was utterly insufficient to cover the requirements of the Department.

div.p: Gov Botanist and Director of the botanic Garden

The Honorable the President of the Board of Land & Works
McKean minuted his approval for M's requests on 22 November 1869. The position, E. Agg, informed M on 26 November: 'that the transfers in question have been sanctioned by His Excellency the Gov in Council'. M returned the file on 26 October: 'with best thanks'.
